Pre-reqs: (Fourth-year standing. Consult with Advisor for specific prerequisites.)
Course Topic: The Psychobiology of Physical Activity.
This course will provide an in-depth exploration of our current understanding of the relationship between mental well being and physical health, and will examine the psychological, neurobiological, epigenetic, and inflammatory processes that are improved as a result of physical activity and the role of genetics in these associations. This course is structured as a seminar course, pulling from the animal and human literature with observational and intervention designs, with course evaluation based on weekly thought papers, 2 presentations, and a research design component.
description: Current topics and research in specific areas.
